responses.name: default
responses.response: I'm not sure I understand your question. Can you please rephrase?

responses.name: greeting
responses.response: Hello! How can I assist you today?

responses.name: symptoms
responses.response: Sorry to hear that. Can you tell me more about your symptoms?

responses.name: medication
responses.response: I'm not a doctor, but I can provide general information about medications. Can you tell me more about your condition?

responses.name: greeting
responses.response: Hello, thanks for visiting.

responses.name: goodbye
responses.response: See you later, thanks for stopping by.

responses.name: thanks
responses.response: Happy to help!

responses.name: hours
responses.response: We are open daily from 9am to 9pm.

responses.name: location
responses.response: We are located in Guwahati, Khanapara.

responses.name: age
responses.response: My owner Aniruddha Das is 38 years old.

responses.name: name
responses.response: You can call me AniD.

responses.name: funny
responses.response:
Why did the hipster burn his mouth? 
 He drank the coffee before it was cool.

responses.name: query1
responses.response: Signs of a heart attack include chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea, and lightheadedness. Call emergency services immediately.

responses.name: query2
responses.response: If someone is choking, encourage them to cough and perform abdominal thrusts (Heimlich maneuver). Call emergency services if the obstruction doesn't clear.

responses.name: query3
responses.response: Signs of a stroke include face drooping, arm weakness, and speech difficulty. Act FAST: Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call emergency services.

responses.name: query4
responses.response: If someone has a severe burn, cool the burn with cool water, cover with a clean cloth, and seek medical attention immediately.

responses.name: query5
responses.response: Signs of anaphylaxis include hives, swelling, and difficulty breathing. Administer epinephrine (if available) and call emergency services immediately.

responses.name: query6
responses.response: If someone has a suspected broken bone, immobilize the injury, apply a cold compress, and seek medical attention immediately.

responses.name: query7
responses.response: To treat a plantar wart, use over-the-counter treatments, keep the area clean, and avoid sharing personal items. Consult a doctor for persistent warts.

responses.name: query8
responses.response: If someone has a deep cut, apply pressure to stop bleeding, clean the wound, and seek medical attention for stitches or further treatment.

responses.name: query9
responses.response: Signs of heatstroke include high body temperature, rapid pulse, and confusion. Cool the person down and seek medical attention immediately.

responses.name: query10
responses.response: If someone has frostbite, gently warm the affected area and seek medical attention for further treatment.

responses.name: query11
responses.response: Signs of poisoning include nausea, vomiting, and confusion. Call poison control and seek emergency medical attention immediately.

responses.name: query12
responses.response: If someone has an electric shock, turn off the power source (if safe), and call emergency services immediately.

responses.name: query13
responses.response: Signs of hypothermia include shivering, confusion, and slowed heart rate. Warm the person slowly and seek medical attention immediately.

responses.name: query14
responses.response: If someone has a bee sting, remove the stinger if visible, wash the area, and apply a cold compress. Seek medical attention if symptoms worsen or if there's an allergic reaction. Use antihistamines for swelling.

responses.name: query15
responses.response: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart is blocked, while cardiac arrest is when the heart suddenly stops beating. Both are medical emergencies requiring immediate attention.

responses.name: query16
responses.response: Heat exhaustion is a milder form of heat-related illness, while heatstroke is a severe and life-threatening condition. Both require cooling and hydration, but heatstroke needs immediate medical attention.

responses.name: query17
responses.response: If someone has a snake bite, keep the person calm, immobilize the bitten area, and seek medical attention immediately.

responses.name: query18
responses.response: Signs of a pulmonary embolism include shortness of breath, chest pain, and coughing up blood. Seek emergency medical attention immediately.

responses.name: query19
responses.response: If someone has a nosebleed, have them sit upright, lean forward, and pinch the nostrils together. Apply ice and seek medical attention if bleeding doesn't stop.

responses.name: query20
responses.response: Signs of a diabetic emergency include high or low blood sugar levels, confusion, and dizziness. If conscious, give sugar or glucose and seek medical attention.

responses.name: query21
responses.response: If someone has a sprain, rest the injured area, apply ice, and elevate the limb. Seek medical attention if pain and swelling persist.

responses.name: query22
responses.response: Signs of a severe allergic reaction include difficulty breathing, swelling, and a rapid pulse. Administer epinephrine (if available) and call emergency services immediately.

responses.name: query23
responses.response: If someone has a heat rash, keep the affected area dry and cool. Avoid tight clothing and use calamine lotion for relief.

responses.name: query24
responses.response: Signs of a seizure include uncontrollable shaking, confusion, and loss of consciousness. Protect the person from injury and call emergency services if it lasts more than five minutes.

responses.name: query25
responses.response: If someone has an eye injury, do not rub the eye, gently rinse with water, and cover with a protective shield. Seek medical attention immediately.

responses.name: query26
responses.response: High cholesterol can be caused by an unhealthy diet, lack of exercise, smoking, and genetics.

responses.name: query27
responses.response: If someone has a concussion, have them rest and avoid physical activity. Seek medical attention for diagnosis and treatment.

responses.name: query28
responses.response: Signs of a spider bite include pain, swelling, and redness around the bite. Clean the area and apply a cold compress.

responses.name: query29
responses.response: To prevent osteoporosis, consume a diet rich in calcium and vitamin D, engage in regular weight-bearing exercise, avoid smoking, and limit alcohol consumption. Consult your healthcare provider for personalized advice.

responses.name: query30
responses.response: To treat acid reflux, avoid trigger foods, eat smaller meals, elevate the head of your bed, avoid lying down after eating, and use over-the-counter medications. Consult your healthcare provider if symptoms persist.

responses.response: Symptoms of anemia include fatigue, weakness, pale skin, shortness of breath, and dizziness. Consult a doctor for proper diagnosis.

responses.response: To lower high blood pressure, reduce salt intake, maintain a healthy diet, exercise regularly, avoid smoking, and limit alcohol consumption. Consult your healthcare provider for personalized advice.
